content.question: Which of the following results of correlational studies implies that environment contributes to the determination of IQ?

choices.label: Correlations are higher for identical twins than for fraternal twins.
Correlations are higher for children and their biological parents than for children and their adoptive parents.
Correlations for two children in the same family are lower when one of the children is adopted than when bothÂ are the biological offspring of the parents.
Correlations for children and their adoptive parents are statistically significant and positive.

content.answer: Correlations for children and their adoptive parents are statistically significant and positive.

skill.text: 3.C: Interpret quantitative or qualitative inferential data from a given table, graph, chart, figure, or diagram.
